name: Lost Lands: A Hidden Object Adventure
description: Persecuted by ill fate, the elven nation land on a lost island. They'll need sharp blades as well as sharp minds to survive. An exciting hidden-object adventure game which tells the story of an ancient elven tribe forced to survive on a long-lost island.
minimum_requirements: OS: XP/Vista/7/8/10 Processor: 1.6 GHz Memory: 512 MB RAM DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 350 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Lost Lands: A Hidden Object Adventure has received quite a lot of negative reviews during the first days after it was released, and this because of 2 main reasons: on one hand, the game had a lot of bugs of various severity (from typos or bad translations to crashes, achievements unlocking and the impossibility to start the game on some systems); on the other hand, the game featured two achievements that were obtainable only by investing a huge amount of real money (around $200) that attracted the anger of a lot of people, including myself.   However, the feedback that the community received from the developers is quite impressive – not only they changed the paid achievements but they also started to fix the major bugs and they are currently working on fixing the minor issues too, and all this in a very short period of time.  The game itself is not entirely bad, it’s quite repetitive but at the same time it was designed to hook you up, just like the standard smartphone/Facebook games. The fact that you have a limit to the actions you can do in one play session might or might not make you revisit the game next day, to progress some more.  The gameplay consists mainly in solving hidden object scenes that award some items used to complete the quests or collections or unlock additional bonuses. The fact that you have a most 15 locations (depending on your level, 1 - 15) that you visit over and over again adds to the monotony of the game – but on the bright side, after you solve 3-4 times the same hidden object scene, you learn exactly where all the objects are which makes it much easier afterwards.  Additionally, you can receive some chests from killing mobs, but unlocking them proves to be a real challenge – the puzzles are timed and most often of high difficulty.  For those that want to 1-click solve a chest puzzle or a hidden object scene, there is an in-game shop from which they can buy items in exchange for real money. The shop also provides all the objects needed for unlocking new locations or completing the collections. However, in comparison with most of the other pay-to-win games, all these items can be acquired also by playing the game, without spending a cent of real money, but of course these drop in small amounts so one is expected to invest a lot of patience and time to finish this game.  The objects in the hidden object scenes and the whole artwork is designed in the style of Artifex Mundi games, meaning that overall the artwork is nice and with vibrant colors; the objects are quite visible but at the same time hidden strategically so that they blend perfectly into the background, making them harder to be spotted, which is by definition one of the characteristics of this genre.  At the moment of writing this review, I think that the biggest complaint from the community remains the long time to achieve 100% - in order to do that one needs to revisit every location a few hundred times and all of this require energy; the energy pool is quite small and limited, allowing you to play only 4-5 hidden object scenes in a single play session - this will probably make people loose interest in the game quite quickly since they will not be able to enjoy the game for more than 10 minutes at once. Hopefully, the game parameters will be adjusted in the future.  I decided to give this game a positive review, not only because it is an enjoyable experience (despite the long grind for 100% achievements) but also because of the constructive attitude from the developers, that are actively working on improving our gaming experience.   More reviews on the  Lilly's Corner Curator page

“Our story begins...”  … with a whole lot of waiting, because this is an energy-based hidden object game (unless you're going to throw cash at it after half an hour).  The game gets a tad repetitive, and exploring the same locations over and over can feel like Groundhog Day, only in this case the groundhog is a mace-wielding rat and there's elves. I'm still playing and still entertained so it must be doing something right.  As for the story, I'm sure there was one of those in there somewhere, but I appear to have misplaced it under a pile of having-to-wait-ages (which is a shame). Not sure how it compares to other free hidden-object games since this is my first, but it's a nice game for taking a break from work, etc. Fun puzzles and... hidden-objects... it does what it says on the tin, really. Looking forward to completing it at some point.   ( - ) Negatives - the wait - repetitive - still waiting for the “epic battle against evil” - no Bill Murray  ( + ) Positives + pretty locations with some very well hidden objects (I'm going to make the bold assumption that that was the aim of this here hidden-objects game) + fun puzzles + good for short breaks form work etc... + initial bugs have been fixed so it should be running smoothly

Lost Lands: A Hidden Object Adventure is a free to play Hidden Object game. It worked, looked ok, sounded ok, played ok. This game is more Pay to Advance. Has puzzles also. It is playable but going to annoy you to buy stuff for real money. Try it, but delete if you have to pay.  For more info:         YouTube™ Video:  Lost Lands A Hidden Object Adventure Gameplay 60fps
Hidden object game good if you have too much time.

The game itself is really fun, otherwise I wouldn't have spent 50h I guess.  Unlike some other reviewers I find this Free 2 Play-Model a very good one. Yes, there's time-limited energy involved and you can't play for as long as you like in one setting... but the game NEVER encourages you to spend money to speed something up.  If you're happy to play once or twice a day for 5-20 minutes, this is perfect.
this is nice game

You can finish this game without spending anything. - I just waste more time to come back play this game every time when energy restore. - Energy is full when level up so use all energy before lever up, for this: when near lever up you can open chest will give less exp to use all energy. If you have 0 energy and need 10 exp to level up(example) you can kill monster. When finish quest, should not received rewards before check about exp to level up and energy again. - Save diamon to use in late game, when you can buy restore 100% energy when you have max energy higher. Same that you should save all chests, coins and weapons to use when need like above . When you have no quest, you can use weapons, coins to kill monsters to level up faster to have new quest. - Some quest can do in same time. - When open chest, after 50% of time if you feel you can't finish it you can use tool you have or pause game and check guides. - Final you need a little lucky when explore or kill monster, you will received true item to finish quest so you can save energy to do other things; or when open chest you can received weapons to finish all kill monsters achievement; or collect enough items to finish the collection. Sorry about my bad English.
It is a fun game, very addictive. I just wish I would not run out of life so soon.
Good hidden object game with interesting mini games. Althrough a little repetitive and boring in late game phase.
Was looking for a good puzzle game and this one is certainly that!
very nice easy
I like the whole game it is very fun.
Best game in my Steam Library   Thats what the wife tells me. Chicks dig it apparently. Must be because they like cleaning and sotrying stuff.

It is what it is. People complain about energy systems, but what else would you expect from a free-to-play game? Game is generous with power-ups and other premium items. Chests offer a nice variety in gameplay with their puzzles. Overall, fun game if you can handle playing in 20-25 minute bursts.  Like facebook games but don't like having friends? This one's for you.
High quality, entertaining free-to-play game. Were it not for the energy bar, I'd play this all day!
very fun game looking forword to the sequel.
i lke the mix of hidden obbjecte and quest. the one thing i don't like is when is the night mode appear, it should say before enter a zone is night mode, silhoute or word.
I really love this game. It's a different hidden object game. Every evening I'm playing with.

The energy required for searching is too much, making the player become bored/annoyed unless you buy stuff. With a max of 250 energy atm i play twice a day and I can search the locations for a total of ~10 times.. Other than that it's pretty great!
Love HO games and this adds so much more to it. I'm really enjoying it!!
It's alright. I run out of life too quickly.
it's fun to play when your internet's out and there is absolutely nothing else to do.
very good time passing puzzles not too hard and not too easy
the game is okay if you paient so yes i recmmend this game for other ppl.

as far as hidden object games go this is a pretty good one

yes I recommend it! Really wished the energy lasted alittle longer or was easyer to come by I guess I just enjoy the game to much, boyfriend says he is going to steal my computer cord so I will be off the game long enough for the engery to rebiuld! LOTS & LOTS of FUN!!!!!!!!

It is has challenging HOPs. A nice story line. It would be nice if they would continue it.

Its a great game to come back to every now and then to keep going. Its definitely not a good game if you want to keep going with it on its own for a few hours. It waits for you to come back and takes time.

A great game if you have plenty of spare time and do not mind a fair bit of repetitive action and breaks in the action while waiting to let your 'energy' build up. This, however, can be avoided if you are prepared to make in-game purchases.
Nice game so far, its free but you can only play so much before your energy run out and you need to wait or pay to play some more.
prety good game

The hidden object aspect is a little too simple, but they improved on that with their recent releases. Energy use game, but it refills at a resonable pace, so you can play it on it for a while several times a day. There are achievements as well for the hunters for such things!  Not a bad game altogether...and it's free!

Ifyou like hidden object games you will like this also with the quests it makes a great game

Also the whole running out of 'time' to play, it seems that they really want you to 'pay' for coins and Diamonds. Would rather pay for the game.  If you can resist temptation to spend real money to play the game then it is a good game. If not don't start this game.

it,s a great game.

The Lost Lands: A hidden Ogject Adventure is a good way to spend time working on your observation skills. It how ever is a little tedious trying to gather all the items for the various collections. If you are looking for a game to spend a little time on from day to day this is right up your ally.

the game is entertaining, but the energy takes a while to refresh so you don't play for long when you do play. good casual game

this is a some what easy game. I like the different styles of how to find the objrcts. What makes this eady is that all the objects are pretty much in the same place. over all not a nad game to while away the time.

Ifyou like hidden object games you will like this also with the quests it makes a great game
Fun yet challenging!! Want to keep playing, even when my engergy times out.

A little confusing at first; objective is not clear. Searching for shape of some items is a little difficult to figure out what it is; they need to be a bit less ambiguous. Background music is boring. Overall good game if you enjoy hidden object games.
Pretty good so far. For a free game it's interesting, though I dislike the energy aspect
Great Game,

Though this is how Facebook Hidden games work, I like it's on Steam as my other games are here and I don't play games anywhere else. I wish it was totally free and not only free if you wait until energy refills or you get a free hint but I didn't pay anything to start with so I can deal with it.
My mom likes hidden object games so I was checking it out for her. seemd I like it too.
Game isn't bad, a very typical HOG with a very annoying energy cost to explore locations and a slow refill timer unless you pay.
So far so good, only thing I dislike is the energy system. Having to wait awhile before being able to do much is kind of a pain
I enjoy that the level of each area increases as you gain experience, even though everything is always in the same place, it can still be difficult to remember where to find them.
Very good game, but energy should refill a bit faster
Fun game. Dislike the 'building power' aspect, but hey, they have to make money off of it somehow.
Cool Game!
A wonderfully addictive hidden object game. It reminds me of the old days of Facebook games, but better.
I love games like these! This easy one is great, I love the tasks, they're really easy to follow.

A game where you have to wait for energy to use in order to play, Completing a game of Hidden Objects within a limited time you will be reward you with random items which are used to complete collections, unlock new areas and complete quests. It’s highly repetitive and the stories are pointless (you really don’t need to read a single word in the game.) The quests are the same things over and over, find certain items, play a certain area or interact with the creatures walking around the world map.  You’re constantly shown 'offers' of micro-transactions.  Achievements are a massive grind, you will have to repeat some parts up to 200 times and there’s very little variation between most of them.  Purely just a cash grab for anyone gullible enough to make the in-game purchases. If you want free achievements then go for it, that's the only good thing I can say about this game if you like collecting them but expect some of them to take a long time.

You play a recently revived elf dude who needs to save the world by completing really mundane tasks like finding a fishing net and repairing a wall.   Music isn't bad. Graphics are pretty enough. But there's a long cutscene you can't turn off that plays whenever you load the game. You can skip through it, but you can't turn it off. Also, stamina bar and microtransations! And 'quests' that require that you to use special microtransation items to proceed to the next quest. Like, 'use the hint button! which you only get 10 uses of to begin with. Also very fanservicey female characters from what little I played. Also, have fun playing the same scenes over. and over. and over. and over. Because you need to replay them a ton of times to unlock more of them. Also, I should have like 5 achievements, but none of them unlocked on steam, just in game. Also, there's achievements for spending lots of money on microtransations. Which is really low.  Overall very meh. But steam doesn't allow for ambivilent ratings so I have to go with no. Buy another HO game on sale and ignore this.
Saved games do not get saved to cloud and thus get lost when moving to new pc

This game is not worth your time. You will run out of crystals pretty soon, and you can only buy cristals for real money and it is expensive. You also get crystals by completing some quests but only a couple of them. And when you have run ot of them you have no other way to get your energy levels up than just wait and wait an eternity for them go up again. So you are stucked with no energy which means you cannot explore locations which means you cannot get materials which means you cannot complete quests and get new resoursces. So you are stucked for a looooooong time (if you do not want to put in real money, and the game is not forth it). The story is very vague and doesn't advance at all. It is almost solely gathering resources which becomes very hard early on in the game, as I explained above. If it had been easy to get your energy levels up I guess I would I have enjoyed the game, but now it just feels like a bluff. A supposedly 'free' point and click game, but you cannot advance without buying a lot of things in game instead, for extremely expensive prices.

The game itself is not so bad, similar to any HOG game, but it uses this stupid facebook-games-energy system. After some time it really becomes horrible, you have to wait for 7-8 hours to get full energy (and with full energy you can play for 5-10 minutes). Of course, you can buy energy potions for $$$, but the prices are rediculous.   Sure, you can try it since it's free, but you will soon be disappointed. And please, do not buy anything, do not support greedy developers!
Kind of slow and very reptile.
Typical Big Fish Games style. Lame story telling, time-dependant energy meter, escalating energy costs for quests, and a lot of ads to purchase more in-game currency.
This is terrible!
I hate waiting. The game has fun graphics, but a bit BigFish-y.
Nice hidden object game but energy renewal so slow..
Pay to win annoyance.
I dislike this game.
Yet another microtransaction game, but it keeps you from wasting too much tim eon it. Not that stimulating.
This game freezes up during the tutorial at the beginning. Very dissappointing.

As a FREE hidden object game, I liked it very much to start. There are lots of quests and areas to unlock to keep things interesting as you level up. The hidden objects themselves are not very difficult to find, though. Annoyingly, I can only play a few minutes a day due to having to use energy for each action. Of course you can purchase potions and things to extend your energy (microtransactions). I can ignore and forgive that because the game is free. HOWEVER, when I logged in one day after 15 hours of ten-minutes-at-a-time gameplay, my game was RESET TO LEVEL 1! At this point, it doesn't matter if it is free - it's no fun to play a game that disrespects the time you've put into it and forces you to start from scratch.  If the energy limitations, microtransactions, and spirit-deflating bug were removed, this would be a really fun casual game.

Garbage, this game belongs on facebook.. not on steam. You quickly run out of 'energy' points that you need to search the scenes. The way it is constructed you either have to only play it for a couple minutes a day, wait, or pay to buy more energy so you can play a game not really worth paying for. Not reccommended, don't waste your time. I only got to level three after playing for about ten minutes and was out of energy and would have had to wait a hour for the bar to be refilled. No thank you, go back to facebook with your trash game.
It really sucks that it takes so much energy to do the puzzles....your life energy doesn't last long enough.
